comments.body: Maybe it could be "I hope you aren't afraid of the dark..." instead
and you could get a warden helmet!
YeSssSsssss i love it
oh yeah, i thought of this too in a post i made. it could introduce all kinds of new foods!

I like the idea of bananas, but I don't know if it is convenient to release them in jungle trees, maybe it would work better a type of banana tree (small palms that give bananas) that generates rarely in jungle biomes.
PS: use the translator so don't be surprised if you see a strange word
I think on the announcement tab bananas are on there

I think the best idea would be for it to not drop from jungle leaves. Instead, if you bonemeal jungle leaves, then they have a small chance of growing a banana, which can be broken to drop 3-5 bananas, or more with the Fortune enchantment. They can be eaten to leave behind a banana peel, which is one of the greatest things to put into a composter, which is its only use.
They should add monkeys while they are at it
I think it should be found in the underground cabin. An underground cabin is a wooden structure shown in Minecraft live 2020 warden showcase
I feel like this is fitting because the major nether update added a music disc why not add one for the update everyone has asked for
Jajaj
but don't make it creepy like disc 11 or 13
I'm always up for more music discs.

I think it will be nice if snow becomes a weather event, and not just a variation of rain on the mountains. This way everyone can enjoy a relaxing snowfall (the snow will disappear 3 days after the snowfall).
Also On Top Of Fences, Around Fences, Same With Walls
I agree maybe not multiple layers but one layer on top would add a lot of snow details on builds also maybe icicles from blocks would be nice too
YES that is exactly what I want too! (Every time I would make a post on this stuff it would never get approved)
Woolly cow!! So cute

And maybe the Snow Zombie (who should also generally show up in Snow Biomes).
Snow Zombie attacks have a slow effect. A zombie that freezes in powdery snow becomes Snow Zombie.
I also want pumas, golden eagles and yetis in mountains
you could add a yeti at the highest points of mountains the yeti will have quite a lot of health and dose a lot of damage so it will be a challenge to take out
I really like the stone zombie
It should definitely be slower than boats on ice. Perhaps slightly faster than boats on water would make it pretty balanced.
Combine this idea with the slide block idea, and yes, it would be a fast way to slide down a hill.
Great idea!
I was interpreting this as a similar mechanic to how you spread nylium with bonemeal, but for this case is from rooted dirt to regular dirt.
That would be amazing
It should be worth 10 gamer score
This would be a hilarious achievement i'm voting

Only thing is, if a different, new block is added with a longer name than Waxed Lightly Weathered Cut Copper Stairs, then the achievement would have to be shifted to that new block.

Love the concept and thought though!
I love this idea so much
maybe instead of getting a block with a long name it should be for renaming an item to fit the max count that the game would let you.
Perfect! This is an amazing idea!
Still grieving over the fact that they changed it to exposed :'(

I'd like to add maybe also trapdoors/pressure plates and maybe even actual doors(?) I think it'd be a great addition in terms of steampunk aesthetic and building and maybe they could be activated differently from iron stuff (maybe with an item in your hand or something almost like a key, idk). and ofc they should oxidate

It's clear they're going with a decorational/gadget route with copper, so a copper button makes sense. They could also add copper doors, trapdoor and pressure plates, which would oxidize in the same way as copper blocks, stairs and slabs.

They could work in a similar way as iron. If you want a door that can only be activated with redstone, you'd have 2 options: iron and copper.
Yes, please. I want copper buttons to decorate my steampunk tower.
Copper nuggets should be obtained from a copper ingot. To create a button, you can use copper nuggets, or a copper ingot + redstone dust.

I think copper buttons would be awesome. Maybe they could have a really short time to pop back out (shortening the time the signal is output) but that time could become longer when the copper becomes rusted. I think a unique button like this would be great, and a more functional button made out of a less common resource would be really cool too, especially considering how much copper stuff is being added in 1.21, making it a notable resource like the rest of the ores
I would love this feature in java edition, I hope Mojang considers this

I like the idea, but halfway through reading this I thought that you meant that you wouldn’t know it was there until you fell in. I really like the idea of having more cave biomes. I am imaging walking in Minecraft having no care in the world and falling into a huge gap in the world and now I ably have 1 heart. I like it

Minecraft’s current cave generation already has something like that. Keeping it and improving it would be cool. Some could also have a cap of gravel or sand on top that caves in if you try to mine it.

I think this is a great idea to go up and down caves easily.

Since 1.18, caves are deeper than ever before. Building a giant staircase to go back home after a long day mining, especially if your pickaxe broke and you lost track of the exit, can feel tiresome sometimes.

Sinkholes could also have unique mobs / loot to make them more interesting!

I'm thinking that caves surrounding a sinkhole could have roots in their walls that guide the player to the closest sinkhole. That way you can follow the roots to get to it when you are mining underground in a cave, so you don't miss it.

Water lakes in the bottom, as well as vines hanging from the walls could give great mobility to players for travelling up and down cave levels in a fun way. There would also have to be decorations visible from the outside so that you see the borders of sinkholes when you are running in the overworld so that you don't accidentally fall into one.

I built a sinkole as I imagine it and took some screenshots. I hope they help a lot.
Feel free to use them as you like!

This is cool, but I have one question; why would you make it if it attacks you? unless it drops something valuable, or spawns naturally after generation (like a hostile mob spawn, or iron golems) and drops something that is useful to farm.

they are like the other golems snow golem made of snow drop snow, iron golem made of iron drop iron, and then the geode golem made of amethyst drop amethyst, obviously they'll spawn in the geode from time to time so you can farm them as exp/coble/amethyst farm

I agree because there aren't enough light sources.
I think it would be cool if Chorus Flowers glow and give off some light. Because they look similar, they could both be ingredients for this lamp
And mobs can spawn in amethyst light
I love the idea and maybe they can Emmitt more light than the old light sources.
You should be able to make lamps out of other gemstones, too.
Goat horns may be used to make the candle holder

I think the candle holders should be made out of gold, since every other material but gold has legitimate uses. It should also increase the light given off the candle. Maybe a single candle on a holder could have the same glow as three candles without a holder?
I know dynamic lighting isn't high on the priority list, but candle holders could be used to hold candles allowing them to give light when held
I suggest making wooden candle holders so you can put a single candle on the wall. The color of the candle holder would be different based on the type of wooden planks used
no sería mala idea

What if some of those features could be applied to any biome? "Enchanted - " could be a descriptor and each overworld biome could have its own variation. (it would still have to fit in with the Minecraft vibe tho)
You could add in an enchanted golden apple as a verry rere drop on these trees
It should be an underground biome generating at like -112

BIOLUMINECENT FUNGI!!!! ME LIKEY! Of course I am a *survival* player, I don't need new blocks, I need new kills. eehee. Maybe some elementals in this forest; wood elementals that act as golems, water elementals that throw bolts of water at you (if a pond is available), Truffle Humanoids that act as a weak, swarming group? It'd. Be. Epic.
Hi saya mail
Добавьте пожалуйста археологию,очень интересно же!🙏😀
I need Archeology Update.
Buena idea 😜😜 vota también la mía
Bane means basically “enemy of,” so maybe “Bane of Darkness”
good idea
Melly Dow: You are right. Honestly, they should raise the stack limit and add a 4th row. Is not overpowered, but fair. The basic inventory needs this buff soon
It's such a simple and obvious solution that idk how it hasn't been implemented yet
Yes please this just makes sense.

I liked (back on the first deep caves snapshots) having the two options regarding finding diamonds:

  • Strip mining: safer approach but slow and boring
  • Exploring caves: faster and fun approach but dangerous given there are a lot of mobs and the lack of light
Igualmente creo que se deben solucionar algunos problemas con la generación de montañas al lado de los biomas de mesetas.
Kingbdogz confirmed that they will be renamed to Extreme Hills, like in Bedrock Edition.
